gcci.text: The $3.14/hr H100 pricing reflects constrained supply chains and elevated capex requirements that continue to strain AI infrastructure budgets and limit deployment scalability.

gtpi.text: The $1.25/1M input token pricing indicates aggressive API price compression driving competitive differentiation through model efficiency rather than pure cost leadership.

gagl.text: The 120 TWh annual energy load represents critical grid infrastructure stress that demands urgent nuclear capacity expansion to maintain sustainable AI compute growth.

aipi.text: Convergent pressure from expensive hardware, energy-intensive workloads, and commoditized API pricing reveals unsustainable economics that risk triggering sector consolidation.
